title: Font used for Karstadt - German Retail Company
content:
Hi There

I would be very grateful if anyone can point me in the direction of the font used in the Karstadt logotype

[http://www.karstadt.de/redmedia/unternehmen/en/presse/86.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152527/http:/www.karstadt.de/redmedia/unternehmen/en/presse/86.htm "http://www.karstadt.de/redmedia/unternehmen/en/presse/86.htm")

Many thanks in advance!

ben

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [KARSTADT.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152527/http:/typophile.com/files/KARSTADT.png) | 22.76 KB |
author: breadesign

comments.content: It is Interstate, from Font Bureau.

Hey Dan, how are you?!?

I deeply believe in your know-how, but are you sure about that?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152527/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/")

I'm doing great! Back in Offenbach, for the moment at least…

The Karstadt logo sure looks like Interstate to me… here is a comparison image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152527im_/http:/typophile.com/files/karstadt-logo-maybe_4892.jpg)

The K and the S do look a little tweaked… especially the S!

They definitely use Interstate in some of their advertising and graphics (see [http://www.fontblog.de/neue-karstadt-schrift-albertina](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152527/http:/www.fontblog.de/neue-karstadt-schrift-albertina "http://www.fontblog.de/neue-karstadt-schrift-albertina") – in German; the picture is in Albertina, but Interstate is mentioned in the text)

I don't really see Interstate in the logo - the proportions are quite different, not just on the K and the S.  
It almost looks like a mishmash of different sources, with the special K, s and low R.  
You may want to take a look at Gotham Ultra and then start tweaking.

Certainly a long way from the Karstadt I knew with back in Duesseldorf.
